alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 10:49PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NEWTON...MCDONALD...BARRY AND SOUTHERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM CDT... At 1049 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Pineville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Neosho, Roaring River State Park, Big Sugar Creek State Park, Table Rock Lake, Monett, Aurora, Mount Vernon, Cassville, Seneca, Marionville, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Dodge, Shell Knob, Pierce City, Goodman, Purdy, South West City and Diamond. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 38 and 47. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southwestern Missouri.
